abstract: A.I.G., the insurer that agreed to a government takeover to avert collapse, reached a deal to sell its 50 percent stake in London City Airport to its partners in the venture.
snippet: A.I.G., the insurer that agreed to a government takeover to avert collapse, reached a deal to sell its 50 percent stake in London City Airport to its partners in the venture.
lead_paragraph: The American International Group, the insurer that agreed to a government takeover to avert collapse, reached a deal to sell its 50 percent stake in London City Airport to its partners in the venture. Global Infrastructure Partners, the private equity fund started by the Credit Suisse Group and General Electric, bought out A.I.G.’s stake in the airport, said Rupa Haria, a spokeswoman for London City. The deal will be completed in October. A.I.G. is selling businesses to repay an $85 billion loan. London City was acquired by A.I.G. and Global Infrastructure in 2006
